First of all, we need to understand what a Haiku is. A Haiku is a traditional form of Japanese poetry that has three lines with a syllable count of 5-7-5. Now, when we think about the vast world of books, it is highly unlikely that most books are written using this strict structure of a Haiku.

Additionally, Haiku is not the most common form of poetry used in literature. There are numerous other types of poetry-like sonnets, limericks, free verse, and so on - that writers use for their creative expression. Therefore, the answer to this question is (B) no, most books are not written as a Haiku.
